content.prompt: Brown v. Board of Education of Topeka (1954) was a significant Supreme Court ruling because it

choices.label: placed limitations on the federal government and affirmed the rights of people and of the states
made it illegal for members of the Communist party to be schoolteachers
upheld laws allowing for the internment of ethnic groups during wartime
applied the freedom of press provisions of the First Amendment to the states by means of the Fourteenth Amendment
held the “separate but equal” concept to be a violation of the equal protection clause of the Fourteenth Amendment
